name: graphviz-preview-plus
description: Write and preview GraphViz dot with `ctrl-shift-G`.

liveUpdate.description: Re-render the preview as the contents of the source changes, without requiring the source buffer to be saved. If disabled, the preview is re-rendered only when the buffer is saved to disk.

openPreviewInSplitPane.description: Open the preview in a split pane. If disabled, the preview is opened in a new tab in the same pane.

directionToSplitPreviewPaneIn.description: The direction to split the preview pane to. Usually you want that to be 'right' (the default), unless you edit with a vertical display when 'bottom' is probably better.

useGraphvizCommandLine.description:
Keep unchecked when in doubt.

- Checked: graphviz-preview-plus will use the command line version of GraphViz dot. For this to work GraphViz has to be installed on your machine, and it has to be on your path.
- Unchecked: graphviz-preview-plus will use viz.js for rendering.

GraphvizPath.description:
If you use the command line version of GraphViz, and GraphViz is not on your _path_, you can use this to specify where to find the executable (including the name of the executable e.g. `/Users/christiaanhuygens/bin/dot`).

Leave empty when it's on your path.
